citations.narrative:
The facility does not currently identify puppies at birth. A microchip is used at approximately 8 weeks of age, but no ID
number nor cage card is assigned or maintained prior to this time. It is difficult to verify inventory without early
identification and record maintenance. All puppies on the premises shall be identified at birth by an acceptable method,
such as the use of ID numbers and cage cards.
Correct by: September 15, 2025

Records of heard health and individual treatments are incomplete. Though there are records for some routine
vaccinations, other deworming and heartworm preventions given to the dogs have not been recorded. Topical treatments
recently given to a few of the dogs for mild dermatitis have also not been recorded. Medical records help assure optimal
animal health is maintained. Licensee must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for
APHIS inspection
Correct by: September 15, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Licensee.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(2) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
The facility does not currently identify puppies at birth. A microchip is used at approximately 8 weeks of age, but no ID 
number nor cage card is assigned or maintained prior to this time. It is difficult to verify inventory without early 
identification and record maintenance. All puppies on the premises shall be identified at birth by an acceptable method, 
such as the use of ID numbers and cage cards. 
 
Correct by: September 15, 2025 
3.13(b) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Records of heard health and individual treatments are incomplete. Though there are records for some routine 
vaccinations, other deworming and heartworm preventions given to the dogs have not been recorded. Topical treatments 
recently given to a few of the dogs for mild dermatitis have also not been recorded. Medical records help assure optimal 
animal health is maintained. Licensee must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for 
APHIS inspection 
 
Correct by: September 15, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Licensee. 
 
 n
